revision.comment: His nationality in this case would only be American since there is no proof that he has Italian nationality in legal terms.
revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | image = 05 Sebastian Maniscalco 1251f.jpg | caption = Sebastian Maniscalco | birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1973|7|8}} | birth_place=[[Arlington Heights, Illinois]] | medium = Stand-up | nationality = [[Americans|American]] | spouse = Lana Gomez (m. 2013) | children = Serafina Simone Maniscalco (b. 2017) | website = {{URL|sebastianlive.com/|sebastianlive.com}} |Known for=[[comedy]]}} '''Sebastian Joseph Maniscalco''' (born July 8, 1973)<ref name="vshuttee" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cbheights.info/s/celebrity-height-sebastian-maniscalco-9817|title=CBHeights|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> is an American [[Stand up comedy|stand-up]] comedian.
== Life and career == Maniscalco was born in the Chicago suburb of [[Arlington Heights, Illinois]], of Italian descent.<ref name=chicagotribune2016>{{cite news| url = http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/ct-sebastian-maniscalco-ott-1118-20161115-story.html| title=Sebastian Maniscalco works like a dog to crack you up| first=Dan |last=Hyman|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]| location=Illinois|date= November 21, 2016| accessdate=July 27, 2017}}</ref> After moving to Los Angeles in 1998, Maniscalco began his career performing at open mics in bars and bowling alleys while working as a waiter at the [[Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts|Four Seasons Hotel]] in Beverly Hills, where he worked from 1998 to 2005. In 2005, he began performing regularly at [[The Comedy Store]] in West Hollywood.<ref name="cbarton" /> Since then, he has done a half-hour for [[Comedy Central Presents]] and four hour-long specials. His first special, ''Sebastian Live'', was released on 2 June 2009. His next three specials were aired on [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]], with ''What's Wrong With People'' released on 5 January 2012, ''Aren't You Embarrassed?'', taped in Chicago, released on 14 November 2014, and ''Why Would You Do That?'', taped at the [[Beacon Theatre (New York City)|Beacon Theatre]] in New York City and released in 2016.<ref name="cbarton">Chris Barton, [http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/la-ca-st-sebastian-maniscalco-mixes-it-up-20161023-snap-story.html "Comic Sebastian Maniscalco recounts his road from the Four Seasons to the Comedy Store (and beyond),"] ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', October 20, 2016.</ref><ref name="vshuttee">{{cite news|first=Vic |last=Shuttee|url=http://www.houstonpress.com/arts/sebastian-maniscalco-laughs-at-the-serious-stuff-9341337 | title=Sebastian Maniscalco Laughs at the Serious Stuff|work=[[Houston Press]]| location=Texas|date=April 11, 2017|accessdate=July 27, 2017}}</ref>
Maniscalco was one of four comedians featured in [[Vince Vaughn]]'s ''[[Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights â€“ Hollywood to the Heartland]]'', along with [[Ahmed Ahmed]], [[John Caparulo]], and [[Bret Ernst]]. Maniscalco has also been on Russell Peters' ''Best Night Ever'', ''Comedy Central Presents'', ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'', ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[The Jay Leno Show]]'', ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]'', ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'', and ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]''. Additionally, he appeared in several films, such as ''[[The Nut Job 2: Nutty by Nature]]'', ''[[The House (2017 film)|The House]]'', and ''Cruise'', and he has a podcast called ''The Pete and Sebastian Show'' with fellow comedian [[Pete Correale]]. As of January 2017, they have a show on [[Sirius XM]] satellite radio's [[Raw Dog Comedy]] channel 99. In 2016, Maniscalco appeared on the seventh season of ''[[Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee]]''. He published his memoir ''Stay Hungry'' on February 27, 2018.<ref name="vshuttee" />
== Influences == Maniscalco cites as comedic influences [[George Carlin]], [[Brian Regan (comedian)|Brian Regan]], [[Johnny Carson]], [[Andrew Dice Clay]], [[Bill Burr]], and [[Don Rickles]].<ref>{{cite interview |last= Miller |first= Dennis |interviewer= Dennis Miller |title= The Dennis Miller Show |last2= Maniscalco |first2= Sebastian |url= http://sebastianlive.com/interviews/dennismiller/ |date= 2012-03-27 }}</ref>
==Personal life== Maniscalco married Lana Gomez, a Los Angeles painter, in 2013, and they welcomed a baby girl, Serafina Simone Maniscalco, on May 12, 2017.
